data.title: Terrible
data.text:
I went for dinner with a couple of Friends. The place overall, didn't seem to clean. I observed a few napkins and the likes on the floor.  Even when the place was empty  there was no hostess and waited for about 15 minutes for somebody to come over and sit us down. I order the tortilla soup as an appetizer. The taste was ok , however the pieces of tortilla were stale, very hard , and difficult to chew. I only had a couple of sip and I had returned it. As main dish I order the taco , pretty much the same thing.  The tacos were extremely hard , terrible taste and seem that they were reheated quite a few times , before they were served.    The other people on my party had the same issue with the food.  Terrible taste and most of the food was left  on the table . 
I wouldn't recommend this place at all . In addition, taking into consideration the service, the place and the food, the prices are way to expensive .

data.title: Good mexican food at a reasonable price
data.text: This is not gourmet dining, but La Pinata does serve good food and the prices are very reasonable.  Though a bit on the Tex-Mex side, the food is more authentic than most US Mexican restaurants.  The menu is extensive and has the typical offerings. One delight if you are hungry or sharing is the whole snapper.  Drinks are very generous and will make the food go down that much easier.

data.title: Good lunch spot
data.text: I stopped in while my wife was in surgery just up the street.  I appreciated the size of the portions on the lunch menu. Good salsa. Lots of parking nearby.

data.title: hang out
data.text:
my husband had a tortilla soup which he enjoyed a lot, taste was fresh and flavor good. I enjoyed the tostada salad because it has a combination of beans on the bottom and topped off with lettuce, chunks of chicken, salsa and avocado. I like to stay on the healthy side..
the ambient is nice but on weekends and Fridays it can get crowded; however, there are two big rooms nicely decorated and many times the waiting it's not too long. I like the margaritas there and the mojitos. they have parking but if it's full one can parked on the street..

data.title: Good mexican food in a fun atmosphere
data.text: Really enjoyed hanging out and sharing a meal with friends here. We all ordered various things. There was not a bad item among the group. We all enjoyed our meal, and conversation greatly. The service was unobtrusive, well timed, and on point.

data.title: Our Weekly lunch spot.
data.text: We go there every week to have lunch with friends. They serve good Mexican food and you can find other items on the menu like a burger. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The decor is average and you can eat outside under a very large tree. The prices are typical. Only problem is the noise level inside is very high when busy.

data.title: Huge burritos
data.text: The food is amazing but I can never finish my food. The food is great and there's always leftovers. Nothing bad to say about this place. It's incredible.

data.title: Good place foe Mexican food.
data.text: Been here several times and the food has always been good. This restaurant has been here for years and every time we have gone there it has been good food.

data.title: Great Mexican Food and Outstanding Spicy Margaritas
data.text: It was worth the wait.  Had a spicy margarita at the bar while waiting for our table.  Large menu to select from.  Large plates of entries.  Great place to take your family.

data.title: Disclaimer: did not even get in to be able to eat here
data.text:
This is a review of a visit to this restaurant, but we did not get to actually eat here, because we never got seated.  This review is just a general warning that the service may not always be the greatest.  We were here on a Monday evening and found the restaurant about 2/3 full by the appearance of it.  We were told that we would have about a fifteen to twenty minute wait, which we felt was reasonable.  After a few minutes outside, we were not sure that they would know where to find us, so one of our party went back into the hostess and came out with a pager.  Then two of us remained outside reviewing the extensive menu, and the third person sat at the bar.  About twenty-five minutes later, we still had not been called, so we returned to the hostess stand.  We were told that the wait would now be thirty minutes.  No one had been out to give us any updates, and we were never given a satisfactory reason of why the wait would be getting longer.  The restaurant never appeared to be full.  I realize that it's not always a matter of tables, but sometimes staffing is an issue.  On the other hand, the staffing ought not to have changed between the time that we arrived and after we had waited nearly a half hour, and even if something unexpected did happen to extend our wait, someone ought to have updated us, as it would be only courteous.  Given that there was no guarantee that we would even be able to get in after another half hour wait, we gave up and went elsewhere.

My friends had been to the restaurant in the past, and had assured me that the food had been quite good, so the restaurant probably deserves a much better review, but it assumes that you can get in.

data.title: Poor service and sub par food
data.text: When this restaurant first opened it was a great place to eat and it was a family friendly environment. The acoustics in this place have always made it difficult to have a conversation even when the place is less than half full, but the food was decent so we overlooked the noise as best we could.  However, the last 3 years, the service and quality of food have declined significantly, especially on the weekends.  I think they are catering more to the bar customer and not families.  Save yourself the money (and your hearing) by going up the street to Los Gallos in Todos Santos Square or hit up the hole-in-the-wall El Farolito behind the downtown fire station.

data.title: Celebrate at La Pinata
data.text: Our school staff have some after school gatherings and we have been welcomed by La Pinata.The tasting plates are large and the food is good. If you get there for the happy hour you get a deal on the appetizers. Great salsa and the  chips are tasty .A fun atmosphere !

data.title: Viva!
data.text: Love coming here with friends to sip on a margarita and fill up on the delicious food.  There is always too much to eat so bringing some home is a nice treat.  The atmosphere is inviting and the service is always with a smile.

data.title: Mild Mexican food
data.text:
Had the combination plate number 6, Enchilada, tamale, Taco. They have an interesting approach to Mexican food. First, withhold all the spices. Second make everything taste the same.

The best of the three was the enchilada. I had the beef although I ordered the chicken. It came with shredded beef that was pretty tough.  The sauce was pretty good although it had no heat in it. The Tamale was too much corn meal and the sauce was flavorless. I ended up not eating all of that. The soft Taco was more tough shredded beef, and lots of very wet lettuce. Water from the beef and lettuce came pouring out of it when I picked it up causing a minor flood which thrilled the drouth stricken Californians in the room. Chips were the real think and crunchy side and the salsa was the right consistency and not too chunky but really lacking in heat. The best thing about La Pinata is the Tequila collection, there are hundreds of brands of tequila in the bar and restaurant, so by all means, take a shot. And enjoy the Diego Rivera like murals in the dining room.

data.title: Done with La Pinata
data.text: Everytime I come here I have to wait and not because they are busy but because of poor service. So I am done. After a  server makes eye contact and acknowledges you but does not even bring water to your table for almost 10 minutes theres a problem. We should have left then. Again, my husband wanted crispy chicken tacos and by the time they get to the table they are anything but crispy, they are soggy from the grease. They have good chips and dip, so-so guacamole and mediocre mexican food. I suppose you come here for the tequila and drinks which they have an abundance. They have several better mexican restaurants in the area, smaller but much better food.

data.title: Large Mexcian restaurant in Concord
data.text:
The restaurant seems popular by the crowd I have seen on evenings and weekends. It is a very large traditional setting restaurant in the middle of Concord near Todos Santos Park. They have lots of wait staff. The food is a variety of traditional Mexican food and lots to eat. The food I thought was ok, but they have a big menu with lots of food listings. I felt like the wait staff was more rushing me. Maybe it was just me...
They also have outdoor patio eating as well adjacent to the sidewalk and streets. They also have a bar inside for alcohol drinks.
The restaurant is located near several variety of stores, banks, parks, fire station, farmers market, and the city has lots of other local activities in the area for visitors. This is a very happening city for tourists and residents. The nearby park has events like Christmas tree lighting, and concerts in the summer.

data.title: Great Authentic Mexican Food and Tequila Bar
data.text: This is definitely our "go to" Mexican Restaurant. The dishes are authentic, as well as delicious! Chips and salsa Yum! And about any type of tequila you could want. I have never had an entree I didn't thoroughly enjoy! We have had great service, and we have also had so-so service, but the food makes up for that!

data.title: Go to Mexican favorite
data.text: This is my go to restaurant for Mexican food. The portions are very generous. Everything I've had has been very good. And you must get the pitcher of margarita! Great deal, and one of the best I've had.

data.title: Drinks were ok
data.text: Besides the drinks not being all that impressive, the rest of the place was great. Had a great vibe and feel to it.

data.title: Very mediocre.
data.text: The food here is incredibly bad, and I think the only reason that people go here is for the late hours and the drinks. Would not recommend this place to anyone looking to eat decent food.
